thread.title: Microsoft working to bring open source VP9 HD codec support to Edge
thread.title_full: Microsoft working to bring open source VP9 HD codec support to Edge

title: Microsoft working to bring open source VP9 HD codec support to Edge
text: Microsoft working to bring open source VP9 HD codec support to Edge Tuesday, 8 September 2015 (9 minutes ago) The technology may exist that allows for ultra-fast transfer of very large files, but the efficient storage of data remains important in many circumstances. Streaming video is one area in which efficiency is particularly important, and the codec used to encode footage has a large bearing on performance. With the launch of Windows 10 , Microsoft took the opportunity to unleash a new web browser on the world -- Microsoft Edge. Today the company reveals that it is working to bring WebM/VP9 to the browser. Initially destined for Windows Insider in Windows 10 Preview builds, VP9 support will improve Edge's abilityâ€¦ [Continue Reading]
